history.content:
For 61B, start projects immediately, but also plan out your code structure wisely. Talk it out with your peers, TAs, and instructors. For doing well on exams, just keep doing practice exams until you know the test inside and out. If you make a mistake, make sure you understand why and are able to answer it later.

For the data structures and algorithms you learn, this goes without saying, but make sure you really learn how each one works, their runtimes, and the differences between them. 

(Leaving CS70 for someone else(s) to answer)


----


For 70, just make sure you don't get too absorbed into the 61B projects that you forget about 70. You might think you'll just take it easy on the hw or skip lecture and before you know if, nothing makes sense anymore. Make sure you stay on track and do NOT fall behind. Also, do the hw option.

For the data structures and algorithms you learn, this goes without saying, but make sure you really learn how each one works, their runtimes, and the differences between them.

children.subject: Seconding the 70 answer, do the homework option. It really helps keep you on track.

Yes, it is still worth it to do hw option. It is graded on accuracy but that's is why doing it with a group is good and going to hw party. You can confirm your answers with course staff at hw parties. 

Even if you are sure you are going to do the hw, usually people do better on hw than tests. There are a couple geniuses who get 2 standard deviations or whatever above average and for those people it might be a consideration but at that point, you would get an A either way. 

There were times when I didn't want to do the hw becaue I had so much other work. If I didn't have the mandatory hw, then I definitely would not have done it and fell behind because you won't have time later to do two hws. 

My recommendation is to do hw option either way. 110%.

Hey guys, 

So CS70 HW assignments are graded my accuracy correct? Is the HW worth enough to bring down your grade a little if you don't get the solutions correct? 

In that case, can it be beneficial to just do the test only grading option, if you are 100% sure that you can keep up with the hw regardless of it not being graded?

I handwrote notes for CS 70. I didn't write any equations, just definitions. Honestly, I never looked back at the notes to study because the online lecture notes were far superior; it's just that taking notes kept me awake in class.
How do most of you guys take notes in 61b and 70? Typing, writing by hand, specific formats, etc.?

history.content:
Hi, 

I am taking 61B and CS70 next semester. 

Is there any advice you guys can give to me to be successful in both classes? 

Thanks!
history.subject: 61B and CS70 Advice
